meanings.definition: The hardening or thickening of a body part, typically due to the deposition of calcium salts.
meanings.sent1: The sclerotizations in the bone made it stronger.
meanings.sent2: The doctor explained that the sclerotizations in the joint were causing stiffness.
meanings.sent3: The sclerotizations in the carrot were so tough, even the rabbit had trouble eating it.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was like the sclerotizations of steel, unyielding to any challenge.
meanings.sent5: The sclerotizations in the tree bark protected it from damage during the storm.

meanings.definition: The process of becoming rigid or inflexible.
meanings.sent1: Over time, the sclerotizations of his beliefs prevented him from considering new ideas.
meanings.sent2: The sclerotizations of the old rubber band made it snap easily.
meanings.sent3: The sclerotizations of the rules were so strict, even the teacher had to follow them.
meanings.sent4: Her mind's sclerotizations were like walls, blocking out any doubts.
meanings.sent5: The sclerotizations of tradition kept the ceremony unchanged for centuries.

meanings.definition: The formation of hardened structures in an organism.
meanings.sent1: The scientist studied the sclerotizations in the insect's exoskeleton.
meanings.sent2: The sclerotizations in the plant's stem provided extra support.
meanings.sent3: The sclerotizations in the rock formation looked like ancient ruins.
meanings.sent4: The city's growth was marked by the sclerotizations of concrete buildings.
meanings.sent5: The sclerotizations in the coral reef created a sturdy habitat for marine life.
